Classes.Name: IArchiveHandler
Classes.Description: Provides an interface for creating portions of the vfs tree from archive files.

Members.Name: MapArchive
Members.Description: Get the root node of the mapped vfs subtree
Members.ReturnDescription: The root node of the mapped vfs subtree

Args.Name: name
Args.Description: The name of the archive

Args.Name: physicalPath
Args.Description: The physical path on disk containing the archive

Args.Name: parent
Args.Description: The VFS parent node of the archive

Members.Name: IsArchive
Members.Description: Whether this file/directory is recognised as an archive type
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the file is a recognized archive file to be handled by this handler

Args.Name: physicalPath
Args.Description: The physical path on disk of a possible achive file

Members.Name: DisposeArchive
Members.Description: Tells the archive handler to dispose of an archive which it previously created

Args.Name: archive
Args.Description: An archive previously created by this handler

Members.Name: Dispose
Members.Description: Tells the archive handler to dispose of itself.

Classes.Name: ICommonHost
Classes.Description: Provides an entrypoint for a module to interact with the MGDF host. Methods in this interface are safe to be used from any thread

Members.Name: GetRenderSettings
Members.Description: Get the render settings manager
Members.ReturnDescription: The render settings manager

Members.Name: GetLogger
Members.Description: Get the host logger
Members.ReturnDescription: The host logger

Members.Name: GetTimer
Members.Description: Get the host timer
Members.ReturnDescription: The host timer

Members.Name: GetMGDFVersion
Members.Description: Gets the current version of the framework

Members.Name: GetVFS
Members.Description: Get the virtual filesystem
Members.ReturnDescription: The virtual filesystem

Members.Name: GetD3DDevice
Members.Description: Get the direct3d device object from the host
Members.ReturnDescription: The direct3d device object from the host

Members.Name: GetD2DDevice
Members.Description: Get the direct2d device object from the host
Members.ReturnDescription: The direct2d device object from the host

Members.Name: GetErrorDescription
Members.Description: Get a text description for an MGDF error code
Members.ReturnDescription: A text description for an MGDF error code

Args.Name: err
Args.Description: The error code to get a description for

Members.Name: GetErrorString
Members.Description: Get a text name for an MGDF error code
Members.ReturnDescription: A text name for an MGDF error code

Args.Name: err
Args.Description: The error code to get the name of

Classes.Name: IErrorHandler
Classes.Description: Provides a means to shut down the host when a fatal error is encountered.

Members.Name: FatalError
Members.Description: This method should be invoked when a fatal error is encountered.

Args.Name: sender
Args.Description: The location or component the error occurred in

Args.Name: message
Args.Description: Details of the fatal error

Classes.Name: IFile
Classes.Description: Provides an interface for navigating a file/directory structure in the virtual filesystem. Directories have no data but can have subfiles Files have no subfiles (except for archives) but may have data. Archives that have been added to the vfs are mapped as files with the same name as the archive filename, but unlike normal files they also have a tree of subdirectories containing the uncompressed archive data

Members.Name: GetName
Members.Description: Gets the name of this file.
Members.ReturnDescription: The name of this file

Members.Name: GetParent
Members.Description: Gets the parent of this file.
Members.ReturnDescription: The parent of this file. If this file is the root of the virtual filesystem, then this will be nullptr

Members.Name: GetChild
Members.Description: Gets a child of this file with the given name (if any).
Members.ReturnDescription: The child file of the current file. If no such file exists, nullptr is returned

Args.Name: name
Args.Description: The child name of this file

Members.Name: GetAllChildren
Members.Description: Get all the children of this file (non-recursive) which match the given wildcard filter.
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the supplied buffer is large enough to hold all the results, otherwise returns false and sets the size required in bufferLength.

Args.Name: filter
Args.Description: A user supplied filter to filter the results

Args.Name: childBuffer
Args.Description: An array to store the results

Args.Name: bufferLength
Args.Description: The length of the childBuffer. Will be set to the length of the buffer required when the method returns

Members.Name: GetChildCount
Members.Description: Get how many children this file has.
Members.ReturnDescription: How many children this file has

Members.Name: IsFolder
Members.Description: Determines if the file entity is a folder
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the file is a folder

Members.Name: IsOpen
Members.Description: Determines if the file has an open reader
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the file has an open reader

Members.Name: Open
Members.Description: Attempt to open the file for reading.
Members.ReturnDescription: Nullptr if the file cannot be opened or is already open

Args.Name: reader
Args.Description: Will point to any reader that is created

Members.Name: IsArchive
Members.Description: Determines if the file is a (or is a member of) an archive file
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the file is a (or is a member of) an archive file

Members.Name: GetArchiveName
Members.Description: Gets the name of the archive the file belongs to (if any)
Members.ReturnDescription: The name of the archive file the entity belongs to, otherwise it returns nullptr

Members.Name: GetPhysicalPath
Members.Description: Get the pyshical path to the IFile in the filesystem
Members.ReturnDescription: The pyshical path to the IFile in the filesystem, in the case of an archive submember this will be the address to the containing archive

Members.Name: GetLogicalPath
Members.Description: Get the path to the file as expressed as a vfs logical file path (i.e.
Members.ReturnDescription: The path to the file as expressed as a vfs logical file path

Members.Name: GetLastWriteTime
Members.Description: Find the last write time of the file
Members.ReturnDescription: A timestamp indicating the last write time

Classes.Name: IFileFilter
Classes.Description: Provides an interface for filtering files from result sets. Clients should implement this interface and pass instances into the relevant VFS methods in order to filter results

Members.Name: Accept
Members.Description: Whether to include a file in a set of results.
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the file is to be included in a result set, and false if it should be excluded

Args.Name: childname
Args.Description: The name of the file to be filtered

Classes.Name: IFileReader
Classes.Description: Provides an interface for reading data from a file.

Members.Name: Close
Members.Description: Closes the file reader, this object cannot be used after this is called

Members.Name: Read
Members.Description: Reads the specified number of bytes into the buffer
Members.ReturnDescription: The amount of bytes actually read into the buffer

Args.Name: buffer
Args.Description: A buffer to store the read data

Args.Name: length
Args.Description: The max amount of data that can be read into the buffer

Members.Name: SetPosition
Members.Description: Sets the read position of the file in bytes

Args.Name: pos
Args.Description: The read position of the file in bytes

Members.Name: GetPosition
Members.Description: Get the current read position of the file in bytes
Members.ReturnDescription: The read position in the file

Members.Name: EndOfFile
Members.Description: Determines whether the file read position has reached the end of the file
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the read position is past the end of the file

Members.Name: GetSize
Members.Description: Get the size of the file in bytes
Members.ReturnDescription: The filesize in bytes (for compressed archives this value is the uncompressed size)

Classes.Name: IGame
Classes.Description: Provides information regarding the current game being run and the preferences associated with that game.

Members.Name: GetName
Members.Description: Get the name of the current game running
Members.ReturnDescription: The name of the current game running

Members.Name: GetInterfaceVersion
Members.Description: Get the interface version the current game supports
Members.ReturnDescription: The interface version the current game supports

Members.Name: GetUid
Members.Description: Get the uid of the current game running
Members.ReturnDescription: The name of the current game running

Members.Name: GetVersion
Members.Description: Get the version of the current game running
Members.ReturnDescription: The version of the current game running

Members.Name: HasPreference
Members.Description: Determine if the game has a preference for the given key
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the key has an associated value

Args.Name: name
Args.Description: The preference name

Members.Name: GetPreference
Members.Description: Determine if the game has a preference for the given key and return its value.
Members.ReturnDescription: The value associated with the key or nullptr if there is no such key

Args.Name: name
Args.Description: The preference name

Members.Name: SetPreference
Members.Description: Change the value of a preference

Args.Name: name
Args.Description: The preference name

Args.Name: value
Args.Description: The new preference value

Members.Name: SavePreferences
Members.Description: Save the current preferences list

Members.Name: ResetPreferences
Members.Description: Reload all preferences to thier user independent default values

Classes.Name: IGamepad
Classes.Description: Provides the ability to query the state of and control other properties of an XInput compatible gamepad connected to the PC. gcconner

Members.Name: IsConnected
Members.Description: Determines if a controller is connected
Members.ReturnDescription: True if if a controller is connected

Members.Name: IsButtonDown
Members.Description: Determines if a button is pressed
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the button is being held down

Args.Name: button
Args.Description: The gamepad button code representing the desired button

Members.Name: IsButtonUp
Members.Description: Determines if a button is NOT pressed
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the button is not being pressed

Args.Name: button
Args.Description: The gamepad button code representing the desired button

Members.Name: IsButtonPress
Members.Description: Determines if a button press has occured
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the button has been pressed (i.e pressed down then released)

Args.Name: button
Args.Description: The gamepad button code representing the desired button

Members.Name: GetLeftTrigger
Members.Description: Returns the state of the controllers left trigger
Members.ReturnDescription: 0 for idle to 255 for fully held

Members.Name: GetRightTrigger
Members.Description: Returns the state of the controllers right trigger
Members.ReturnDescription: 0 for idle to 255 for fully held

Members.Name: GetLeftThumbX
Members.Description: Returns the state of the left thumbstick on the X axis
Members.ReturnDescription: -32768 for far left to +32767 for far right

Members.Name: GetLeftThumbY
Members.Description: Returns the state of the left thumbstick on the Y axis
Members.ReturnDescription: -32768 for top to +32767 for bottom

Members.Name: GetRightThumbX
Members.Description: Returns the state of the right thumbstick on the X axis
Members.ReturnDescription: -32768 for far left to +32767 for far right

Members.Name: GetRightThumbY
Members.Description: Returns the state of the right thumbstick on the Y axis
Members.ReturnDescription: -32768 for top to +32767 for bottom

Members.Name: SetVibrationSpeed
Members.Description: Sets the vibration intensity in the left and right vibrator motors of the controller, valid values are 0-65535

Args.Name: left
Args.Description: The intensity of the left vibrator motor

Args.Name: right
Args.Description: The intensity of the right vibrator motor

Classes.Name: IInputManager
Classes.Description: Provides a means for modules to access information regarding user input from the mouse, keyboard, and xinput controllers.

Members.Name: ShowCursor
Members.Description: Determines whether the OS cursor is displayed or not

Args.Name: show
Args.Description: Whether to show the cursor or not

Members.Name: IsKeyDown
Members.Description: Determines if a key is presed
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the key is being held down

Args.Name: key
Args.Description: The Microsoft Virtual key code representing the desired key (see here for a list http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd375731%28v=vs.85%29.aspx)

Members.Name: IsKeyUp
Members.Description: Determines if a key is NOT pressed
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the key is not being pressed

Args.Name: key
Args.Description: The Microsoft Virtual key code representing the desired key (see here for a list http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd375731%28v=vs.85%29.aspx)

Members.Name: IsKeyPress
Members.Description: Determines if a keypress has occured
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the key has been pressed (i.e pressed down then released)

Args.Name: key
Args.Description: The Microsoft Virtual key code representing the desired key (see here for a list http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd375731%28v=vs.85%29.aspx)

Members.Name: GetMouseX
Members.Description: Get the x position of the mouse
Members.ReturnDescription: The x position of the mouse relative to the left of the screen in pixels

Members.Name: GetMouseY
Members.Description: Get the y position of the mouse
Members.ReturnDescription: The y position of the mouse relative to the top of the screen in pixels

Members.Name: GetMouseDX
Members.Description: Get the x movement of the mouse in the current frame
Members.ReturnDescription: The x movement of the mouse in the current frame

Members.Name: GetMouseDY
Members.Description: Get the y movement of the mouse in the current frame
Members.ReturnDescription: The y movement of the mouse in the current frame

Members.Name: GetMouseDZ
Members.Description: Get the position of the scroll wheel
Members.ReturnDescription: The position of the scroll wheel, this value will be between -120 and 120

Members.Name: IsButtonDown
Members.Description: Determine if a mouse button is down
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the button is held down

Args.Name: mouseButton
Args.Description: The mousebutton code representing the desired button

Members.Name: IsButtonUp
Members.Description: Determine if a mouse button is up
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the button is NOT held down

Args.Name: mouseButton
Args.Description: The mousebutton code representing the desired button

Members.Name: IsButtonClicked
Members.Description: Determine if a mouse button was clicked
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the button has been clicked, i.e held down then released

Args.Name: mouseButton
Args.Description: The mousebutton code representing the desired button

Members.Name: GetGamepads
Members.Description: Gets a list of all compatible gamepads connected to the PC
Members.ReturnDescription: A list of all compatible gamepads connected to the PC

Classes.Name: ILogger
Classes.Description: Provides an interface to the MGDF logging system.

Members.Name: SetLoggingLevel
Members.Description: Set the current logging verbosity level

Args.Name: level
Args.Description: The verbosity level

Members.Name: GetLoggingLevel
Members.Description: Get the current logging verbosity level
Members.ReturnDescription: The current logging verbosity level

Members.Name: Add
Members.Description: Write an entry to the log

Args.Name: sender
Args.Description: The location or component writing the log message

Args.Name: message
Args.Description: The content of the log message

Args.Name: level
Args.Description: The verbosity filter for writing out the message. The message will be written if this is less than or equal to the current logging level

Classes.Name: IModule
Classes.Description: An interface which game modules must implement. The MGDF host will call the various module methods in order to allow the game module to respond to events. Methods prefixed with ST will be invoked by the host from the sim thread, methods prefixed with RT will be invoked by the host from the render thread, and methods without a prefix may be invoked by the host from either thread.

Members.Name: STNew
Members.Description: Called by the host after a module is first created and should be used to do perform any initialization required by the module.
Members.ReturnDescription: False if the module experiences a fatal error on initialization

Args.Name: host
Args.Description: The simulation thread host

Args.Name: workingFolder
Args.Description: A folder that the module can read/write data to while its running

Members.Name: STUpdate
Members.Description: Called once per simulation timestep by the host once the game is running and represents the main sim loop.
Members.ReturnDescription: False if the module experiences a fatal error updating the scene

Args.Name: host
Args.Description: The simulation thread host

Args.Name: elapsedTime
Args.Description: The simulation timestep

Members.Name: STShutDown
Members.Description: Called by the host to tell the module to cleanup and shutdown as soon as possible.

Args.Name: host
Args.Description: The simulation thread host

Members.Name: STDispose
Members.Description: Called by the host to dispose of the module.
Members.ReturnDescription: False if the module experiences a fatal error cleaning up

Args.Name: host
Args.Description: The simulation thread host

Members.Name: RTBeforeFirstDraw
Members.Description: Called by the host immediately before the first call to RTDrawScene.
Members.ReturnDescription: False if the module experiences a fatal error

Args.Name: host
Args.Description: The render thread host

Members.Name: RTDraw
Members.Description: Called by the host once per render frame.
Members.ReturnDescription: False if the module experiences a fatal error drawing the scene

Args.Name: host
Args.Description: The render thread host

Args.Name: alpha
Args.Description: How far between the current and next simulation frame (0-1)

Members.Name: RTBeforeBackBufferChange
Members.Description: Called by the host if the swap chain options need to be changed, or the display window needs to be resized.
Members.ReturnDescription: False if the module experiences a fatal error

Args.Name: host
Args.Description: The render thread host

Members.Name: RTBackBufferChange
Members.Description: Called by the host after the swap chain options has been changed, or the display window has been resized.
Members.ReturnDescription: False if the module experiences a fatal error

Args.Name: host
Args.Description: The render thread host

Members.Name: RTBeforeDeviceReset
Members.Description: Called by the host if the dxgi device needs to be removed.
Members.ReturnDescription: False if the module experiences a fatal error

Args.Name: host
Args.Description: The render thread host

Members.Name: RTDeviceReset
Members.Description: Called by the host after the dxgi device has been reset, the module should recreate any device dependent resources that were removed in RTBeforeDeviceReset.
Members.ReturnDescription: False if the module experiences a fatal error

Args.Name: host
Args.Description: The render thread host

Members.Name: Panic
Members.Description: Called by the host when a fatalError event occurs.

Classes.Name: IPerformanceCounter
Classes.Description: A names performance counter that can be used to time the duration of events. The results of these counters are shown in the MGDF stats overlay (press ALT-F12 to see in game)

Members.Name: GetName
Members.Description: Gets the name of the counter.
Members.ReturnDescription: The name of the counter

Members.Name: Begin
Members.Description: Begin timing.

Members.Name: End
Members.Description: End timing and record the duration between the time when begin was called and when End was called.

Classes.Name: IRenderHost
Classes.Description: Provides an entrypoint for a module to interact with the MGDF host. This interface inherits from ICommonHost and provides additional methods which are safe to be used ONLY from the render thread.

Members.Name: GetD3DImmediateContext
Members.Description: Get the direct3d device immediate context object from the host
Members.ReturnDescription: The direct3d deviceimmediate context object from the host

Members.Name: GetRenderTimer
Members.Description: Get the direct3d timer object from the host
Members.ReturnDescription: The direct3d timer object from the host

Members.Name: SetBackBufferRenderTarget
Members.Description: Set the current back buffer as the render target for the specified d2d device context
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the back buffer can be set as the render target for the device context

Args.Name: context
Args.Description: The d2d device context to set the render target for

Members.Name: GetBackBuffer
Members.Description: Gets the current back buffer texture.

Members.Name: GetBackBufferDescription
Members.Description: Gets the description of the backbuffer texture.

Args.Name: desc
Args.Description: The backbuffer description to populate

Classes.Name: IRenderSettingsManager
Classes.Description: Provides an interface for getting and setting the hosts various display settings.

Members.Name: GetVSync
Members.Description: Gets the current vsync setting
Members.ReturnDescription: True if vsync is enabled

Members.Name: SetVSync
Members.Description: Sets the current vsync setting

Args.Name: vsync
Args.Description: True if vsync is to be enabled

Members.Name: GetFullscreen
Members.Description: Gets the current fullscreen setting
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the game is in fullscreen mode

Members.Name: SetFullscreen
Members.Description: Sets the current fullscreen setting

Args.Name: fullscreen
Args.Description: True if the game should display in fullscreen mode

Members.Name: GetMultiSampleLevelCount
Members.Description: Get the number of supported multisample levels
Members.ReturnDescription: The number of supported multisample levels

Members.Name: GetMultiSampleLevel
Members.Description: Get the available multisample level supported by the display adaptor at the given index ( 0 to GetMultiSampleLevelCount() - 1 )
Members.ReturnDescription: True if a supported multisample level is present at the given index, false otherwise.

Args.Name: index
Args.Description: The multisample index

Args.Name: level
Args.Description: Returns the multisample level at the given index

Members.Name: SetBackBufferMultiSampleLevel
Members.Description: Set the display adaptors current multisample level, this changed setting is not applied until ApplySettings is called.
Members.ReturnDescription: Returns false if the desired multisample level cannot be set.

Args.Name: multisampleLevel
Args.Description: The desired multisample level for the backbuffer

Members.Name: GetBackBufferMultiSampleLevel
Members.Description: Get the current multisample level in use by the adaptor
Members.ReturnDescription: The current multisample level in use by the adaptor

Members.Name: SetCurrentMultiSampleLevel
Members.Description: Set the desired multisample level for off screen render targets.
Members.ReturnDescription: Returns false if the desired multisample level cannot be set.

Args.Name: multisampleLevel
Args.Description: The desired multisample level for off screen render targets

Members.Name: GetCurrentMultiSampleLevel
Members.Description: Get the current desired multisample level for off screen render targets
Members.ReturnDescription: The current desired multisample level for off screen render targets

Args.Name: quality
Args.Description: If specified this parameter will be initialized with the maximum multisampling quality setting for the current multisample level

Members.Name: GetAdaptorModeCount
Members.Description: Get the number of supported adaptor modes
Members.ReturnDescription: The number of supported adaptor modes

Members.Name: GetAdaptorMode
Members.Description: Get a supported adaptor mode at the given index (0 to GetAdaptorModeCount - 1 )
Members.ReturnDescription: True if an adaptor mode exists at a particular index

Args.Name: index
Args.Description: The adaptor mode index

Args.Name: mode
Args.Description: Will be set to the the adaptor mode at the given index

Members.Name: GetAdaptorMode
Members.Description: Get the adaptor mode (if any) matching the requested width and height, if no matching adaptor is found, false is returned
Members.ReturnDescription: True if a supported adaptor mode exists for the given width and height

Args.Name: width
Args.Description: The desired width of the adaptor mode

Args.Name: height
Args.Description: The desired height of the adaptor mode

Args.Name: mode
Args.Description: Will be set to the matching adaptor mode found (if any)

Members.Name: GetCurrentAdaptorMode
Members.Description: Get the current adaptor mode being used when running in fullscreen mode

Args.Name: mode
Args.Description: Will be set to the current adaptor mode being used.

Members.Name: SetCurrentAdaptorMode
Members.Description: Sets the current display adaptor mode when running in fullscreen mode, this changed setting is not applied until ApplyChanges is called.
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the adaptor mode is supported and can be applied, false otherwise

Args.Name: mode
Args.Description: The adaptor mode to use

Members.Name: SetCurrentAdaptorModeToNative
Members.Description: Sets the current display adaptor mode when running in fullscreen mode to the screens native fullscreen resolution.
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the adaptor mode could be changed, false otherwise

Members.Name: SetWindowSize
Members.Description: Sets the size of the window when running in windowed mode.

Args.Name: width
Args.Description: The width of the window

Args.Name: height
Args.Description: The height of the window

Members.Name: GetScreenX
Members.Description: Get the current screen width, based on the current adaptor mode in fullscreen, or on the window dimensions otherwise
Members.ReturnDescription: The current screen width

Members.Name: GetScreenY
Members.Description: Get the current screen height, based on the current adaptor mode in fullscreen, or on the window dimensions otherwise
Members.ReturnDescription: Thr current screen height

Members.Name: ApplyChanges
Members.Description: Queues the swap chain to be reset on the beginning of the next frame.

Classes.Name: IRenderTimer
Classes.Description: This provides an interface to Direct3D GPU timers

Members.Name: CreateGPUCounter
Members.Description: Create a performance counter for profiling GPU time taken in DirectX API calls.
Members.ReturnDescription: MGDF_ERR_GPU_TIMER_UNSUPPORTED if GPU counters are unsupported (using D3D_FEATURE_LEVEL_9_3 or less) otherwise returns MGDF_OK

Args.Name: name
Args.Description: The name of the counter

Args.Name: counter
Args.Description: Points to the created counter

Classes.Name: ISimHost
Classes.Description: Provides an entrypoint for a module to interact with the MGDF host. This interface inherits from ICommonHost and provides additional methods which are safe to be used ONLY from the sim thread.

Members.Name: BeginSave
Members.Description: Tells the host to provide a location on disk to save the current game data.
Members.ReturnDescription: MGDF_OK if saveBuffer is large enough to fit the supplied save directory, otherwise returns MGDF_ERR_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL. If the saveName is invalid, the function returns an error code

Args.Name: saveName
Args.Description: The name of the module save file. Only alphanumeric characters and space are valid characters.

Args.Name: saveBuffer
Args.Description: The buffer to fill in the supplied save directory

Args.Name: size
Args.Description: The size of saveBuffer, if saveBuffer is too small, size will be changed to the size required.

Members.Name: CompleteSave
Members.Description: Finalizes the save data for a matching call to BeginSave
Members.ReturnDescription: MGDF_OK if the saveName was in a pending state and was completed successfully, if there was a problem, or the saveName didn't exist then an error code is returned.

Args.Name: saveName
Args.Description: The save to complete

Members.Name: GetSaves
Members.Description: Populates the supplied vector with the names of all saved instances of this configuration The names returned in this list represent all the valid arguments to queueLoadState for the current configuration

Members.Name: RemoveSave
Members.Description: Deletes a selected save game from the hard drive

Args.Name: saveName
Args.Description: The save to remove

Members.Name: Load
Members.Description: Tells the host to find the location on disk for the specified save game
Members.ReturnDescription: MGDF_OK if saveBuffer is large enough to fit the supplied load directory, otherwise returns MGDF_ERR_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL. If the saveName is invalid, the function returns an error code

Args.Name: saveName
Args.Description: The name of the module save file

Args.Name: loadBuffer
Args.Description: The buffer to fill in the supplied save directory

Args.Name: size
Args.Description: The size of saveBuffer, if saveBuffer is too small, size will be changed to the size required.

Args.Name: version
Args.Description: The version number of the save game. can be useful for migrating save games.

Members.Name: GetGame
Members.Description: Get information regarding the current game and its preferences
Members.ReturnDescription: Object containing information regarding the game and its preferences

Members.Name: GetSound
Members.Description: Get the audio manager
Members.ReturnDescription: The audio manager, nullptr if the audio subsystem failed to initialize

Members.Name: GetStatistics
Members.Description: Get the statistics manager
Members.ReturnDescription: The statistics manager

Members.Name: GetInput
Members.Description: Get the input manager
Members.ReturnDescription: The input manager

Members.Name: ShutDown
Members.Description: Tells the host to shut down the game immediately

Members.Name: QueueShutDown
Members.Description: Tells the host to invoke the modules shutdown callback

Classes.Name: ISound
Classes.Description: An audio source in 3d space.

Members.Name: GetName
Members.Description: The name of the sound.
Members.ReturnDescription: The name of the sound

Members.Name: GetPosition
Members.Description: The position of the sound.
Members.ReturnDescription: The position of the sound

Members.Name: GetVelocity
Members.Description: The velocity of the sound.
Members.ReturnDescription: The velocity of the sound

Members.Name: GetInnerRange
Members.Description: The distance (from the observer) at which the sound intensity reaches its maximum.
Members.ReturnDescription: The distance (from the observer) at which the sound intensity reaches its maximum. Getting closer than this will not cause the sound intensity to get any greater

Members.Name: SetInnerRange
Members.Description: Set The distance (from the observer) at which the sound intensity reaches its maximum.

Args.Name: innerRange
Args.Description: The distance (from the observer) at which the sound intensity reaches its maximum. Getting closer than this will not cause the sound intensity to get any greater

Members.Name: GetOuterRange
Members.Description: The distance (from the observer) at which the sound intensity reaches 0.
Members.ReturnDescription: The distance (from the observer) at which the sound intensity reaches its 0

Members.Name: SetOuterRange
Members.Description: Set The distance (from the observer) at which the sound intensity reaches 0.

Args.Name: outerRange
Args.Description: The distance (from the observer) at which the sound intensity reaches 0

Members.Name: GetSourceRelative
Members.Description: Does the sound stay relative to the listeners position or is it fixed in absolute space.
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the sound is always relative to the listeners position

Members.Name: SetSourceRelative
Members.Description: Does the sound stay relative to the listeners position or is it fixed in absolute space.

Args.Name: sourceRelative
Args.Description: True if the sound is always relative to the listeners position

Members.Name: GetVolume
Members.Description: Get the current volume of the sound (ignoring attenuation due to position).
Members.ReturnDescription: The current volume of the sound (ignoring attenuation due to position)

Members.Name: SetVolume
Members.Description: Set the current volume of the sound (ignoring attenuation due to position).

Args.Name: volume
Args.Description: The current volume of the sound (ignoring attenuation due to position)

Members.Name: GetPitch
Members.Description: Get the pitch of the current sound.
Members.ReturnDescription: 1.0 if the pitch is unchanged. between 0.5 and 1.0 is lower, and between 1.0 and 2.0 is higher pitched

Members.Name: SetPitch
Members.Description: Set the pitch of the current sound.

Args.Name: pitch
Args.Description: 1.0 if the pitch is unchanged. between 0.5 and 1.0 is lower, and between 1.0 and 2.0 is higher pitched

Members.Name: SetPriority
Members.Description: Set the priority used by the sound system to determine which sounds get deactivated if not enough sound sources are available to play all sounds.

Args.Name: priority
Args.Description: The priority to use for the sound. Higher values mean higher priority

Members.Name: GetPriority
Members.Description: Get the priority used by the sound system to determine which sounds get deactivated if not enough sound sources are available to play all sounds.
Members.ReturnDescription: Priority the priority to use for the sound. Higher values mean higher priority

Members.Name: GetLooping
Members.Description: Get whether the sound will loop playback continously.
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the sound should loop continously

Members.Name: SetLooping
Members.Description: Set whether the sound will loop playback continously.
Members.ReturnDescription: Looping true if the sound should loop continously

Args.Name: looping
Args.Description: True if the sound should loop playback, false otherwise

Members.Name: Stop
Members.Description: Stop the playing of the current playlist if it was playing or paused (resets playlist to the beginning aswell)

Members.Name: Pause
Members.Description: Pause the playing of the current playlist (if it was playing)

Members.Name: Play
Members.Description: Resume the playing of the current playlist (if it was paused or stopped)

Members.Name: IsStopped
Members.Description: Determines if the playlist has stopped play
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the playlist has stopped play

Members.Name: IsPaused
Members.Description: Determines if the playlist has paused play
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the playlist has paused play

Members.Name: IsPlaying
Members.Description: Determines if the playlist is playing
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the playlist is playing

Members.Name: IsActive
Members.Description: Returns true if the sound manager has culled this sound source

Classes.Name: ISoundManager
Classes.Description: Provides an interface for processing sounds in 3d space.

Members.Name: GetListenerPosition
Members.Description: Determine the position of the listener (i.e.
Members.ReturnDescription: The position of the listener (i.e. the player)

Members.Name: GetListenerVelocity
Members.Description: Determine the velocity of the listener (i.e.
Members.ReturnDescription: The velocity of the listener (i.e. the player)

Members.Name: GetListenerOrientationForward
Members.Description: Get the vector representing the forward direction of the listener (i.e.
Members.ReturnDescription: The vector representing the forward direction of the listener (i.e. the player)

Members.Name: GetListenerOrientationUp
Members.Description: Get the vector representing the upward direction of the listener (i.e.
Members.ReturnDescription: The vector representing the upward direction of the listener (i.e. the player)

Members.Name: GetSoundVolume
Members.Description: Get the master volume (0-1) All sounds volumes are relative to this setting.
Members.ReturnDescription: The master volume

Members.Name: SetSoundVolume
Members.Description: Set the master volume (0-1) All sounds volumes are relative to this setting.

Args.Name: volume
Args.Description: The master volume

Members.Name: GetStreamVolume
Members.Description: Get the master volume for streamed sounds (0-1) All streams volumes are relative to this setting.
Members.ReturnDescription: The master stream volume

Members.Name: SetStreamVolume
Members.Description: Set the master volume for streamed sounds (0-1) All streams volumes are relative to this setting.

Args.Name: volume
Args.Description: The master stream volume

Members.Name: GetEnableAttenuation
Members.Description: Get whether sounds should attenuate with thier distance from the listener.
Members.ReturnDescription: True if sounds should attenuate with thier distance from the listener

Members.Name: SetEnableAttenuation
Members.Description: Set whether sounds should attenuate with thier distance from the listener.

Args.Name: enableAttenuation
Args.Description: True if sounds should attenuate with thier distance from the listener

Members.Name: GetDopplerShiftFactor
Members.Description: Get whether sounds will doppler shift based on thier relative velocity to the listener.
Members.ReturnDescription: Whether sounds will doppler shift based on thier relative velocity to the listener

Members.Name: SetDopplerShiftFactor
Members.Description: Set whether sounds will doppler shift based on thier relative velocity to the listener.

Args.Name: dopplerShiftFactor
Args.Description: True if sounds should doppler shift based on thier relative velocity to the listener

Members.Name: GetSpeedOfSound
Members.Description: Get the speed of sound used to calculate doppler shifting of sounds.
Members.ReturnDescription: The speed of sound used to calculate doppler shifting of sounds

Members.Name: SetSpeedOfSound
Members.Description: Set the speed of sound used to calculate doppler shifting of sounds.

Args.Name: speedOfSound
Args.Description: The speed of sound used to calculate doppler shifting of sounds

Members.Name: CreateSound
Members.Description: Create a sound by loading a file in the VFS into memory.
Members.ReturnDescription: MGDF_OK if the sound was created successfully, otherwise an error code will be returned

Args.Name: file
Args.Description: The data source for the sound

Args.Name: priority
Args.Description: The priority of the sound (used to determine what should play if no free audio sources are available

Args.Name: sound
Args.Description: If the sound is created successfully, this will point to the created sound

Members.Name: CreateSoundStream
Members.Description: Create a sound stream from a file in the VFS.
Members.ReturnDescription: MGDF_OK if the stream was created successfully, otherwise an error code will be returned

Args.Name: file
Args.Description: The data source for the sound stream

Args.Name: stream
Args.Description: If the stream is created successfully, this will point to the created stream

Classes.Name: ISoundStream
Classes.Description: An audio stream.

Members.Name: GetName
Members.Description: The name of the sound stream.
Members.ReturnDescription: The name of the sound stream

Members.Name: GetVolume
Members.Description: Get the volume level (0-1).
Members.ReturnDescription: The volume level (0-1)

Members.Name: SetVolume
Members.Description: Set the volume level (0-1).

Args.Name: volume
Args.Description: The volume level to set

Members.Name: GetPosition
Members.Description: The position of playback in the stream (0 -> GetLength).
Members.ReturnDescription: The position of playback in the stream

Members.Name: GetLength
Members.Description: The total length of the stream.
Members.ReturnDescription: The total length of the stream

Members.Name: Stop
Members.Description: Stop the playing of the current stream if it was playing or paused (resets it to the beginning aswell)

Members.Name: Pause
Members.Description: Pause the playing of the current stream (if it was playing)

Members.Name: Play
Members.Description: Resume the playing of the current playlist (if it was paused or stopped)
Members.ReturnDescription: MGDF_OK if the sound could resume playing, otherwise returns an error code.

Members.Name: IsStopped
Members.Description: Determines if the stream has stopped play
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the stream has stopped play

Members.Name: IsPaused
Members.Description: Determines if the stream has paused play
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the stream has paused play

Members.Name: IsPlaying
Members.Description: Determines if the stream is playing
Members.ReturnDescription: True if the stream is playing

Classes.Name: IStatisticsManager
Classes.Description: Provides an interface for recording statistics during a game session. If the game has a statistics service configured, the stats log will be uploaded by the GamesManager at the end of a play session.

Members.Name: SaveStatistic
Members.Description: Logs a statistic as a key/value pair.
Members.ReturnDescription: MGDF_OK if the statistic could be saved, MGDF_ERR_INVALID_STATS_KEY if the statistic key was invalid due to containing a space character or being more than 255 characters in length, MGDF_ERR_INVALID_STATS_VALUE if the statistic value is more than 255 characters in length

Args.Name: name
Args.Description: The name of the statistic tracker key

Args.Name: value
Args.Description: The value of the statistic

Classes.Name: ITimer
Classes.Description: Provides an interface to the hosts high resolution CPU timer.

Members.Name: GetCurrentTimeTicks
Members.Description: Get the current system time in ticks.
Members.ReturnDescription: The current system time in ticks

Members.Name: GetTimerFrequency
Members.Description: Get the current system timer frequency.
Members.ReturnDescription: The current system timer frequency

Members.Name: ConvertDifferenceToSeconds
Members.Description: Convert two system tick times into a duration in seconds.
Members.ReturnDescription: The difference betweeen the two parameters converted into seconds

Args.Name: newTime
Args.Description: The newer of the two times

Args.Name: oldTime
Args.Description: The older of the two times

Members.Name: CreateCPUCounter
Members.Description: Create a performance counter for profiling CPU time taken.
Members.ReturnDescription: MGDF_OK if the counter could be created, otherwise an error code is returned

Args.Name: name
Args.Description: The name of the counter

Args.Name: counter
Args.Description: Points to the created counter

Classes.Name: IVirtualFileSystem
Classes.Description: Provides an interface for accessing the virtual filesystem, which is a fast read only interface to access game content files. The root MGDF virtual filesystem is mounted from the game/content folder.

Members.Name: GetFile
Members.Description: Get the file/folder/archive in the specified logical directory.
Members.ReturnDescription: The file/folder/archive in the specified logical directory. paths are delimited using the / character and names are case sensitive

Args.Name: logicalPath
Args.Description: The vfs path to the file

Members.Name: GetRoot
Members.Description: Get the root node of the virtual filesystem.
Members.ReturnDescription: The root node of the virtual filesystem

Structs.Name: AdaptorMode
Structs.Description: The display settings for a particular adaptor mode.

Functions.Name: GetCompatibleFeatureLevels
Functions.Description: Allows a module to tell the host what D3D11 feature level to try and use when creating the D3D device.
Functions.ReturnDescription: 0 if the supplied levels array is large enough, otherwise returns the size required

Args.Name: levels
Args.Description: An array supplied to the module to fill with acceptable D3D feature levels

Args.Name: levelSize
Args.Description: The size of the levels array

Functions.Name: GetCustomArchiveHandlers
Functions.Description: Allows a module to tell the host if it is going to provide any custom virtual file system handlers.
Functions.ReturnDescription: Returns true if the supplied list is large enough to contain all the items in the list, otherwise returns false and sets the required size in the length parameter

Args.Name: list
Args.Description: A pointer to an array of characters to store the saves in

Args.Name: length
Args.Description: The length of the list array

Args.Name: logger
Args.Description: A callback interface allowing the archive handler to write to the MGDF logs

Args.Name: errorHandler
Args.Description: A callback interface allowing the archive handler to trigger fatal errors

Functions.Name: GetModule
Functions.Description: Factory function which returns an instance of the module to the host.
Functions.ReturnDescription: An instance of the module interface

Functions.Name: IsCompatibleInterfaceVersion
Functions.Description: Allows a module to assert if the host trying to run the module is compatible with the module.
Functions.ReturnDescription: True if the module supports the interface provided by the host

Args.Name: Interface
Args.Description: The MGDF interface version supported by the host

Enums.Description: All the gamepad button types recognized by the input manager.
Enums.Name: GamepadButton

Enums.Description: The logging levels available, LOG_ERROR is of the highest importance with LOG_HIGH messages being of the least importance.
Enums.Name: LogLevel

Enums.Description: Various error codes returned by the MGDF API.
Enums.Name: MGDFError

Enums.Description: This is represents all the various mouse buttons that are recognised by the input manager
Enums.Name: Mouse
